Which combination of objects is available when creating a custom report type for Chatter reports?

discussion.content: It should be mentioned whether 1 answer is required or 2 answers are expected.

Selected Answer: C
The correct answer is:

C. Users, User Feed, Comments

Explanation:

When creating a custom report type for Chatter reports, you can use the following objects to track Chatter activity:
 • Users: Represents the users involved in the Chatter activity.
 • User Feed: Contains the Chatter posts or updates made by users.
 • Comments: Represents comments added to the Chatter posts.

These objects provide a comprehensive view of user interactions and engagement in Salesforce Chatter.

Incorrect Options:
 • A. Opportunities, Followers, User Feed: Opportunities are unrelated to Chatter reports.
 • B. Accounts, User Feed, Comments: Accounts are not part of Chatter-related objects for reporting.
 • D. Chatter Groups, Members: While groups and their members are related to Chatter, they are not part of the core objects used in custom report types for standard Chatter activity.
Actual exam question from Salesforce's ADM-201

Fiscal years are the accounting period used by a company to record and report financial information. Standard fiscal years follow the calendar year (January 1 to December 31), but companies can also use Custom Fiscal Years that start and end on any date.

Forecasting is the process of making predictions about future events or trends based on data and analysis. Standard forecasting is a feature of some software applications that allows users to generate predictions about future events or trends based on historical data. Standard forecasting typically uses a standard time period, such as a calendar year or a fiscal year, as the basis for the predictions.
